intro: Melandrium ajanense, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are ovate with a hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Melandrium ajanense is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
